ygData.subject: RE: Re: Time for a new weapon
ygData.msgSnippet: I don t know exactly about your server but I take it you are talking about the Tesch Mas Gnolls around the entrance to Splitpaw and not any of the gnolls
ygData.messageBody:
I don't know exactly about your server but I take it you are talking about
the Tesch Mas Gnolls around the entrance to Splitpaw and not any of the
gnolls inside. Consistently on CT I find 1 or 2 groups doing the front
inside gnolls and 1 or 2 high level necros in the Ishva's room. The rest of
the place is clear.

Good Journey

Sineras Silverlyre, The Divine Alliance (Cazic-Thule)

-----Original Message-----
From: Kenneth E. Bachman [mailto:kbachman@...]
Sent: Friday, December 17, 1999 1:29 AM
To: eqbards@onelist.com
Subject: Re: [eqbards] Re: Time for a new weapon


From: "Kenneth E. Bachman" <kbachman@...>

Jason Rochelle wrote:

> From: Jason Rochelle <Jasroc@...>
> ...
> Uldar Ulfangson
> 35th Bard, Rodcet Nife
> (who had a geat day with the HGs today, 7 kills, 4 back-to-back!, 200pp,
> in just 2 hours)

If you don't mind my asking, just where the heck do you FIND seven HGs. In
the last four days, I've seen
exactly three, and one of them was dead. I have also seen zero Griffons.
The new Gnolls are fully
camped, the Spectres have three groups sitting around the lake, Kithicor is
(as I predicted) utterly
uncamped yet still a killer to move through half the time. Bah! I hate
being level 35 on an aging and
crowded server.

Kenross Cantoforjado, 35 songs, Innoruuk (feeling a little cranky)

Please send submissions for the eqbards newsletter to lol@...
with the subject submissions.
